talk.author: did:plc:uae3ottal4tv4qa7ci72b3lq
talk.utter: So your argument is that instead of the government getting 2 billion pounds, they would get to tax the 2 billion and, at best, lose 1.2 billion a year in revenue. And this would be good?

talk.author: did:plc:6xzczlgdl4dklm6hw2xxlgyh
talk.utter: Royal estates would be taken into public ownership. Job done.

talk.author: did:plc:uae3ottal4tv4qa7ci72b3lq
talk.utter: Can't it's against international law, European law, and UK law. If they did that, they would be sanctions from the UN and European Union. France and Germany tried that and reversed course give back a lot property to the royal family.

talk.author: did:plc:uae3ottal4tv4qa7ci72b3lq
talk.utter: Can't it's against international law, European law, and UK law. If they did that, they would be sanctions from the UN and European Union. France and Germany tried that and reversed course give back a lot property to the royal family.

talk.author: did:plc:6xzczlgdl4dklm6hw2xxlgyh
talk.utter: When was the last time Germany and France had a royal family? Also, you forget that UK is not a member of the EU.

talk.author: did:plc:uae3ottal4tv4qa7ci72b3lq
talk.utter: Yes, but it is considered a human rights violation. So they can get sanctioned. And the UK is subject to UK law.

talk.author: did:plc:uae3ottal4tv4qa7ci72b3lq
talk.utter: Yes, but it is considered a human rights violation. So they can get sanctioned. And the UK is subject to UK law.

talk.author: did:plc:6xzczlgdl4dklm6hw2xxlgyh
talk.utter: "Human" rights: I don't think that would hold back the British state, do you? And take a look at English history: Cromwell (Thomas and Oliver), etc., where there's a will there's a way. I'd favour just requisitining the land and redistributing the proceeds (reverse privatisation).

talk.author: did:plc:uae3ottal4tv4qa7ci72b3lq
talk.utter: Yes, but now you have a Supreme Court. I'm just arguing from a practical standpoint. Look at the rest of Europe who did this, and it actually cost them significantly to this day.
